comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The Captain Manuel de Mendivil, going by the three stripes on his epaulettes. See - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16521120

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yes indeed! Thanks beachcomber. And how about our discovery of pianist/impresario/producer/ballet dancer Daphne Deane eh? :) We love the [http://www.flickr.com/photos/national_library_of_australia_commons/]'s Trove!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] I can't find any substantial or relevant articles or biographies in Trove or Google for "Daphne Deane",  except for a novel.  Where did you find her?

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] We found a few Sydney Mail articles through Google but there's also a list on Trove we created. They aren't amazingly detailed articles, but we will do some more searching. You found a novel?
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Thanks for the list. The novel - "Daphne Deane" by Grace Livingstone Hill - books.google.com.au/books/about/Daphne_Deane.html?id=g7WL... . Not connected, I think.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] oh yes, I did see that book, it doesn't seem connected. Otherwise it would be, 'Daphne Deane pianist/ballet dancer/impresario/romance heroine'. Hehe
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
